page.title: 01EDUCATION
page.content: The Helena Romanes Comprehensive built in 1958 and extended in 1970 is set in 35 acres north of Dunmow 1250 boys and girls aged between 11 and 18 years are taught the curriculum by 74 teachers and the headmistress. The capitation for 1985 is Â£38.74.There are 50 employed other than teachers.School starts at 9.15 and ends at 3.40.During this time you have 8 different lessons and three breaks.A period lasts 35 minutes.The school contains 3 libraries and 2 common rooms.Children go there from villages on the outskirts of Dunmow.There are 2 dining rooms 1 is a cafeteria and one is a snack bar.The school has a lot of musical clubs,an orchestra and a band.In the evening Adults can go to evening classes.Many trips are organised by school to foreign countries.
